thread.title_full: SEE IT: Jimmy Kimmel brings mean tweets to Oscars - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Jimmy brings mean to
text:
“Jimmy Kimmel Live’s” funniest gag made its way to the Oscars with a Mean Tweets segment.
Academy Award nominees including Emma Stone, Lin-Manuel Miranda and Casey Affleck read out cruel messages to them from social media — and some were even true.
“Oh look at me I'm Ryan Gosling,” the “La La Land” star read. “I have perfect bone structure and nice eyes. Go f--k yourself, Ryan Gosling.”
His co-star, Emma Stone, read a message from a “fan” who said she looked like a “crack w---e in every role she plays.”
Ryan Gosling was subjected to a mean tweet that insulted his good looks during the Oscars Sunday. (ABC) Miles Teller laughed off his insult as someone who “requests ‘Gangam Style’ at a wedding where he doesn’t know the bride or groom.”
Lin-Manuel Miranda was accused of looking like “he’s getting a 1996 NBC sitcom with his haircut,” while Casey Affleck was compared to “the real-life version of Billy Bob Thorton’s character in ‘Sling Blade.’”
Jeff Bridges confirmed a tweet that said he “wears pants a lot less than we think he does,” while Robert DeNiro fought back against some ageism.
Another mean tweet compared Tilda Swinton to a dog. (ABC) “Robert DeNiro is too old to be making gangsta movies still...dude needs to start playing grandfather roles,” he read.
“I am playing grandfather roles. Pretty soon I'll be playing great-grandfather roles. F--k you,” he responded.
